Instalación

Contents

  • Virtual environment
    • Windows
  • Installation of the Application
  • Deployment

Instalación#

Due to its unstable nature, Net-Tracker requires following certain specific steps for installation. Below are the recommended steps that have been followed to ensure the correct installation of the application.

Virtual environment#

It is recommended to use a virtual environment to keep the application encapsulated from the rest of the system. To install and configure a virtual environment in a UNIX/Linux environment, follow these steps:

$ sudo apt install python3-venv

With the package installed, you should execute the following command to create the environment:

Note

It’s advisable to create a separate directory for the virtual environment.

$ python3 -m venv venv

Where the last venv corresponds to the name that the virtual environment directory will have. With the virtual environment installed and created, you only need to activate it with the following command:

$ source venv/bin/activate

Windows#

If your environment is Windows, the steps to follow are different. When you install Python, the tools to create virtual environments are also installed. To create the virtual environment, execute the following command:

$ python -m venv venv

Warning

In order to execute the python command from the Windows terminal, it needs to be accessible from the PATH.

To activate the virtual environment, you need to execute the following command:

$ .\venv\Scripts\activate

Installation of the Application#

With the virtual environment installed and activated, the next step is to install the application. Currently, being an unstable version, it should be installed from the official repository on GitHub. Below are the commands that need to be executed:

$ git clone https://github.com/VLB3R70/net-tracker-core.git
$ cd net-tracker-core
$ pip install -r requirements.txt --upgrade
$ pip install .

Note

It’s also possible to encapsulate the project’s construction and then install it with the following commands:

$ python -m build
$ pip install .

This method is recommended for use in development environments and never in the system environment.

After the installation, simply execute the command net-tracker to start the application.

Deployment#

The application also requires a connection to a MongoDB database and Docker correctly installed to deploy the API in a container. It’s possible to create a container for the database if you don’t want to have a full MongoDB installation. Inside the project directory, execute the following command:

$ docker compose up -d

With this command, the image of the application established in the Dockerfile is created, and then the container is created with the created image. If we also want to create a container for the database, we need to specify the profile for this container:

$ docker compose --profile db up -d

Once the containers are created and the API is deployed, we can verify it by opening a browser and visiting http://localhost:5000. It’s also possible to access the API from http://<IP>:5000.
